title: [Slight Tweak] Rewarding Soraka for Martyrdom
body:
I've been playing a whole lot of Soraka lately, and I must say I really like the rework. I had my misgivings, but after playing her for several games, I have fallen in love with her gameplay. There is no feeling like turning around a fight with your heals, or getting to your ally in the nick of time. Using your Astral Infusion on a Deathmarked target and then seeing the enemy Zed allchat "F U RAKA" is the best feeling in the world.

That said, I am seeing people discussing Soraka's dangerous positioning in teamfights and especially her unclear itemisation. Smart players are learning that taking out Soraka quickly in teamfights is important, and Soraka has extremely limited options to deal with such eventualities. This leads me to an idea to encourage her martyr-like playstyle:

#Salvation

**NEW:** In addition to her current passive, when Soraka dies, she releases a wave of healing energy in a 400 units circle around her body. Allied champions in the area are healed for [(Level x 40) + 0.4 AP]. If Soraka dies as a result of casting Astral Infusion, the AoE increases to 600 units and the AP ratio increases to 0.6. This effect triggers even if Soraka is under the effect of Guardian Angel or Zilean's Chronoshift.

#Astral Infusion

**REMOVED:** ~~Cannot be cast if Soraka is below 5% of her max health.~~

*-*

Comments and criticism welcome!

And when you start a nwew team fight, killing Soraka first is still the option, because at that point her healing would do nothing as everyone else is at full health anyway.
Exactly, thank you. Nice to see someone who gets it!
Because then you can't be killed for gold! xD

That would be a very bad thing. The fact that it's really easy to turn Soraka's martyr passive into a gold advantage for the enemy team is exactly what the counterplay is. Even if Soraka dies so that her team can win the fight, she's still giving out anywhere from 300 to 900 global gold, depending on how many enemies get assists on her death.

Potentially problematic misunderstanding of assist here: it doesn't get multiplied, it gets divided. If there is two assist, each get only 75.

So a 5v1 does not give any more gold, than  a 2v1.
Huh! Didn't know that, thanks.

Seeing as the general consensus is both that Soraka shouldn't kill herself (no removing min cap on w) and that an aoe heal would leave little counterplay (no aoe heal burst on death), how's this for a suggestion:

---
#Passive: Celestial Overload
When Soraka is dealt lethal damage, the stars recognize her sacrifice and imbue her with power for a short time. During this time, the stars overwhelm her power to sustain her life, disabling Soraka but allowing her to cast her heal for no cost. Soraka can only sustain this overwhelming power for 3/4.5/6 seconds before her time is spent and she dies.
---

This gives Soraka a Karthus-like ult, allowing her to continue healing for a short while, but unable to follow her teammates if the fight moves. This resolves the issue where she is focused first, as if you kill her first she has a few seconds where she can heal at will, making a small area around her dangerous to fight in with her high hps healing. It also allows for the counterplay of keeping her teammates out of her reach, while also tying in with her lore, where the stars took their power from her as punishment for doing harm, as now they can reward her for giving everything to saving people from it.

Thoughts?

I feel that dilutes the identities for both her and Karthus, by making them a polar opposite mirror of each other. Furthermore, if her heals become free, she can cast them on cooldown. At 40% CDR and with 6 seconds of her passive, that can easily equal 5-6 heals, which is basically the same amount of heals Soraka would cast if she was alive (I rarely cast more than 4-5 heals per teamfight).

Overall, it does a lot more healing than my suggested passive and allows her to concentrate that healing into a single person rather than spreading it out into an AoE (which means that some of her heal can be wasted on a full-health target). Your suggested passive also lets her cast her ult, for massive group healing, and even lets her protect her ADC with an Equinox if she has to. It's just way too powerful.
Just pictured her swelling and popping. Kinda twisted way to heal but W/E.

Well, ideally, you can pick up a cue from Celestine Soraka and have her body dissolve into a trail of shiny dust, swept away by the wind. Recolour the particles for each skin: Original Soraka gets purple particles, Dryad's are green, Celestine's are gold and Divine's are deep blue.

If you mean the "Executed!" part, no, the same way you don't get a reverse killing spree if you die to jungle minions or towers 3 times in a row.

These are the ideas I think Rito should actually try out in PBE and if it doesn't work out they just don't bring it to live but it's at least worth testing in my opinion.

I can see why it wouldn't be good since you kind of punish people for doing what they're intended to do which is kill the healer a.k.a Soraka, however you don't lose that much from bringing it to PBE and testing it especially since there is a lot of strong feelings about this rework and most aren't so positive.

I think the key fact is that people still get gold for killing Soraka. The passive makes it so that Soraka isn't "free gold" given how dangerously close to the enemy she needs to be in teamfights.

But yes, I'd love to see this tried out in the PBE!

I don't like this idea because it punishes foes for killing Soraka.

Right now, it's a possibility to consider killing Soraka first to get her healing out of the system, then focus the other carries. But if you give Soraka a healing wave upon death, then enemies are left with a poor choice of options:

1. Focus not-Soraka; Soraka heals her team and you lose.
2. Focus Soraka; Soraka dies but heals her team anyways.

While thematically this makes sense, giving Soraka healing-upon-death is a low-counterplay way to add power to her kit. Soraka, despite staying low, should never actually want to die.

Also, it'll be really sad if someone accidentally kills themselves with a miscalculated infusion :x

\>> If Soraka's healing-upon-death effect a bad idea, then what about other upon-death effects, like Kog'maw, Karthus, Zyra, and new Sion? I think that the other three upon-death effects are fine because they each have counterplay: you can escape or dodge their damage. On the other hand, you can't stop Soraka's upon-death from healing her allies.

The key thing you're forgetting is that people still get gold for killing Soraka. This is extremely important. Soraka is specifically designed to be squishy, and she is punished for going tank. Her healing range puts her right in harm's way. This means that she is literally free gold for any assassin/ADC/APC who wants to delete her. Her self-defense capacities are severely limited (she only has Equinox, and she needs to choose whether to use it to defend herself or to defend her ADC if someone dives them) and her self-heal is designed to mitigate poke and skirmishes, rather than to help her survive burst.

Furthermore, if Soraka kills herself with the W, she still gives the kill to someone who damaged her recently, just as if she died by a tower, minion or neutral monster. Given how close she has to be to the thick of the action in teamfights, it's practically guaranteed that she'll get hit by some random AoE, which means that if she suicides by Astral Infusion, she's still giving gold to someone (or even many, depending on how many assists the enemy gets on her death).

Soraka right now has no counterplay for people who are smart enough to kill her first. Any smart player will realise that damaging Soraka is ten times more effective than damaging anybody else on her team, since her self-heal cannot sustain anything other than "mild poke" (which is really good for laning phase, but rather bad for teamfights). This new passive IS counterplay for the enemy team that just goes "If Soraka gets within healing range, we immediately switch targets and kill her. If she doesn't get within healing range, she can't heal anybody and we just kill her team."

As for the other death passives: If you're melee, you can't actually stop Karthus from dealing damage to you, since he turns on his W automatically and you are right in the centre of it. You may get away before he kills you, sure, but you will take free damage whether you want it or not. Kog'maw's Icathian Surprise is actually impossible to outrun without flash or some dashing shenanigans, and it's designed to be that way. It may not kill you, but it's almost guaranteed you'll be eating a ton of true damage for free. Sion's new passive also gives him a movespeed burst designed to help him catch up with people and get free damage on them. He IS possible to outrun if you dash or are super fast, but they might also tweak this before he comes live. Zyra's is really the only death passive you can really dodge, and it's the most poorly-designed out of them all.

In a teamfight, someone's gold worth shouldn't be part of the decision-making procedure - everyone is worth the same gold anyways (ignoring kill/death sprees). In a teamfight, the question is: "Who do we focus first?"

Right now, the choice is to kill her first to remove her healing. But if she gets a significant healing-upon-death, then no matter what you do she'll heal her team. This negates the effective choice the enemy has because she'll heal her allies no matter what.

Part of the decision making in teamfights is also "how much reward am I getting for my efforts?". If killing Soraka is very easy because she's squishy and must position herself in harm's way, then it's always a good idea to go for Soraka. It's more than just "stopping her healing," but also "I can easily delete this champion from the teamfight, get gold for it, and turn it into a 4v5."

Right now, smart players are turning Soraka's situation into the opposite: the moment a teamfight breaks out, she get focused and dies before she can get a single heal out, or they make her waste her ult to save herself (which is still a net win). Soraka's cc is extremely finicky and hard to land, so her main contribution to the team is healing. She doesn't have the pick potential that a Morgana, Thresh, Blitz, Leona, Nami or Sona (with flash+crescendo) have, she can't tank a crapload of damage like Braum (who also has pick potential with Q and ult), she doesn't have Janna's unparalleled disengage or Zyra's oppressive poke (and again, both of those can make picks with clever uses of their ults).

Those types of supports can make good plays and turn the tide of a teamfight, so it's fine if they die afterwards, they've done their job (and likely traded their lives for that of a more valuable member of the enemy team). Soraka cannot afford to die at all. When I play Soraka, I play her like she's the most valuable team member, even more valuable than the ADC, and if we don't have initiators, I allow my teammates to get caught so that I can then save them and turn the teamfight around. This is why it's imperative that Soraka has a way to do her job even if she dies. If Soraka dies, the team might as well be dead in the water.

I think people still haven't realised that Soraka is a completely different support from everybody else, and requires a completely different playstyle. Right now, she is almost perfect, all she needs is some way to be useful even if she gets focused and dies (which is what this suggestion is aiming for).

Well, if I ignore numbers, there's three ways I see the passive turning out:

1. The passive is strong enough to let Soraka contribute as much as if she had been alive.
2. The passive is weak enough to still punish Soraka for dying while at the same time feeling powerful.
3. The passive is practically nonexistent.

Previously, I'd been focusing on the numbers and assuming you were going for 1, but I guess what you're aiming for is 2. But where is the line between 1 and 2? Can Soraka leave meaningful choice while still having a powerful heal?

I guess in the end, I have no idea how to answer that. Probably worth a test.

I definitely do not want to aim for 1 or 3. 2 is exactly what I want to achieve. Ideally, if Soraka gets focused and dies, she can still dish out a wave of healing that has a chance (but not a guarantee) of helping her team win the fight or at least disengage without taking any further losses. If Soraka gets caught alone and dies, the passive is worthless, so it still encourages Soraka players to play safe and stick by their team.

the idea of a martyrer sora is nice, but considering the rest of her kit, the numbers are to high, and the synergy with zilean/GA is to powerfull.

as a sidenote, i think the rework failed in one important part if playing vs Soraka: her E.
One of the main complains about old sora was her no counterplay silence. So why is it still there? yes u can walk out of it to avoid 50% of the damage and the root, but the extremly frustrating long ranged instant silence still is there and screws any all-in atempts big times. It's still incredible unfun to play against.

The numbers are roughly the equivalent of one W, so it should be fairly standard with the normal healing output Soraka can dish out. The Zilean/GA interaction is on purpose. Have you noticed they are suggesting GA on Soraka's recommended items? It's ridiculous to suggest that item on a support's budget, with how expensive (and selfish) it is, even if it does give Soraka resistances. This passive is precisely what allows GA to become a viable choice for Soraka. The Zilean interaction is there for consistency. Doesn't make any sense for it to proc off GA but not Chronoshift.

Equinox is actually a super difficult ability to use properly and mainly serves as zoning tool or channel interrupt. It works best against channelling opponents (Nunu, Fiddlesticks, Katarina), yes, but it's relatively difficult for it to do anything against other enemies, particularly those with high mobility who can easily ignore the AoE and jump on your carries.

i faced a lot sorakas since rework, and belive me, her E it can NOT get ignored by mobile champs, as the silence means u can't use ur mobillity. if used well, it's a really hard counter to assasins and all-in engages(just like her old silence)

and for the numbers: Salvation is 720+0.4(0.6)ap at lvl 18, W is 230+0.6ap, so the passive is ruthly 3 Ws on aoe, that is not the equivalent of one W.
And the potential aoe with GA or Zil in a teamfight would be insane. 1440+0.8(1.2)ap from salvation + 350+0.55ap(525+0.725ap).
allone the fact that 1salvation out heals soras ult vs low health targets is an indicator that the numbers are a bit off.

Considering that you can walk out of the area at 325 movespeed (slowest movespeed in the game without boots), it's not really a challenge to highly mobile assassins. Simply walk out of the area, then engage your mobility. If Soraka casts it defensively (right on top of herself or a high-priority target), then yeah, you won't be able to kill them easily, that's the entire point. But it's very hard for Soraka to use the ability offensively, especially when it has such a high cooldown.

simpy walk out does not in a fight with more threats than sora. The fact that u have a sec in which u can'T do anything besides walking makes u very vulnerable to any other cc or dmage, which still makes u eat the snare.

while it is not poerefull offensivly, it totally screws all-in champs and is uterly unfun to face.

You realise you can walk *backwards*, right? That is, *away* from danger? Because that's all you need to do. The area lasts 1.5 seconds and has a 18 / 17 / 16 / 15 / 14 second cooldown. And nobody maxes Equinox first or even second. it's strictly last-maxed.

Yes, it does mean you cannot just W in, deathmark someone, combo them and kill them, then W out. That is very much true and it's a *good* thing, because assassins are supposed to be played intelligently. You wait until cooldowns are blown and you engage at the right time. You do not initiate as an assassin.

If you're an actual initiator, your moves have a very long range that puts you in no actual danger. Amumu Q+ult, Leona's E+Q, Malphite ult, Vi ult, Sejuani ult, etc., all of these are long-ranged spells that let you initiate from a safe distance. And if Soraka sees you walking forward and silences you, you just walk out of her zone, wait 1.5 seconds, and then do what you were going to do anyway, only this time Soraka won't have Equinox to prevent your team from doing a follow-up initiation.

for amumu, Q+R, as soon as amumus Q connects, Sora can cast her E and therefor prevent his ultcast, same for many other initiates. The fact that soras E has a effecktive range of 950 makes it a strong counter vs most initiates.
besdies malph and Seju, no champ has a initiation from outside of soras range that wouldn'T need aditional skills to be used after the gapcloser(like zac ulting after E).
if used well, that ~950range ***instant*** silence is extremly powerfull and doesn'T provide counterplay(notice that i speak of the silence and not the root)
another problem is that the spell visualls are very suptile within a clash. Most of the time u just go in and then wonder why u can't use ur skills as there is no telegraphing like other silences have, it's just there in an instant.

If the Q hits Soraka, she's stunned, so she can't cast E before Amumu ults. Furthermore, Amumu can cast his ult even while he's snared by Soraka, and is usually tanky enough to afford to wait the 1.5 seconds it takes for it to wear off. After all, who cares if he's snared? The entire enemy team will be snared right along with him.

Vi can ult people from a long range and is unstoppable by silences once the casting animation begins, with the additional effect of knocking people aside as she goes from her starting point to her target. Nocturne can also ult people from four screens away, as can Pantheon, TF and Ashe. There are plenty of initiations that cannot be countered at all by Soraka. Can she counter some of them? Sure. But Morgana can make the target of an initiation immune to CC with her Black Shield, and stop someone dead in their tracks with her Dark Binding. Sona, Braum, Leona, Thresh and Janna can counter-initiate with their AoE CC just as the enemy team is following up, and turn a teamfight around.

It's good that Soraka has this ability, because she has no hard CC to peel for her carry (or herself).

Also, her AoE is literally a bright orange/indigo sky with shiny constellations. It's incredibly difficult to miss.

if u get hit by amumus Q as sora, u were out of position. ur not meant to be in fron't of ur team.
And if ur team doesn't spread out within the 1.5sec of silence befor amumu can ult, u realy deserve to loose for that massive missplay.
Nocturn is no good engage, he only goes for one target and his only cc is delayed by 2sec. He is good for diving the backline once the fight started, but bad for starting a fight him self as he got no aoe-cc and compareable poor tankiness(or ignorable damage if he goes fulltank).
Vi's ult got less range then soras silence, if she Qs towards ur carry to initiate a fight, u are be able to silence her befor she can ultunless u were to far from ur carry.
Pantheon and TF shoe clearly where they will apear, so u can lay down E right befor they land, which usually ends with theri death if ut team collapses at them.
Ashe does work, but she easily is countered by michaels curcible anyway.
I consider Morgana as one off the most broken champs in the league due to the black shield.
Sona needs her ult, and u actually have time to react on longer distance.
Braum, Leona, Thresh and Janna don't have instand cc, u can juke their skills and react to it. And it'S also more clearly telegraphed. IF u get hit by JAnnas knock up, u know it's her knockup.

While Sorakas E is clearly visible 1v1 or even 2v2, in a clash with alot other effeckts and many champions, it is hard to notice. Overall all cc, not just soras silence, should have a more clear visual effeckt if u get hit by it.

Nothing against some abillity for sora to defend herself or her carry, but it should provid some more counterplay.

why not change equilibrium to a 0.5sec delay(with clear visuals where she is going to cast it), but give it a small slow or increase the aoe over the duration(like cassio W)?
It would still alow her to peel for her carry and deny all-ins, but enemys would have a chance to play around it.

It would be too much like Viktor's W and Swain's W. The reason Soraka's silence needs to be instant is to be able to interrupt channels like Katarina's, Nunu's and Fiddlestick's. Even 0.5 seconds of a Katarina ult can be anywhere from 100 to 300 (or more, depending on how fed she is) damage to up to 3 people. Given that most assassins (when played intelligently) wait until cooldowns are blown, that 100-300 damage might be the difference between Katarina getting a kill after doing a whole combo on an already injured squishy (and therefore getting resets and shunpoing back to safety) and Katarina failing to kill someone and then subsequently dying.

I don't think a channle interupt with 0.5sec delay is that much worse, and if kata is that problematic, it's more an issue with her Ult as u can'T expect to cancle her before 0,5sec of ult - unless u have soraka or stand right next to her with some others.

The reason why Viktors and swains W have a dealy is cause aoe-hard cc on high range would be to strong. But aparently silence isn't seen as hard cc, which is wrong imo.

Soraka's silence has a snare too, if you stay on the AoE for 1.5 seconds. That's the hard cc, and it works exactly like Swain's W and Viktor's W. If you add a delay to it, you make it pretty much identical to those abilities.

I suppose a good compromise could be channel-cancelling for the first .5 seconds, but if that's the case, she needs a buff to compensate. The ability to peel for her carry is something Soraka is very weak at, and a reflexive instant silence is literally ALL she has. If we give her that, she needs some form of hard CC (maybe turn the snare on her E into a stun, and have the Q be a slow that snares if it hits the centre?).

I don'T think she needs tha much of an abillity to peel.
A strong slow on Q and the silence/root of E are strong tools together with the high healing she can provide to her carry.
If u have cc/peeling from other positions, there is really no problem for sora beeing not as strong for peeling, as she therefor has the massive healing.

If u pick sora in a setup with already low cc, it's ur own fault. there are plenty support options if u need more cc, but not that much that would complement an already cc-heavy comp.
She works really well if combined with adc that cc(mf, varus, ashe)

"Zed mid, Tryndamere/Riven top, Lee Sin jungle"
if u pick sora as support into a comp that lacks cc, u simply picked wrong.
Complaining that sora struggles at peeling is like complaining that Braum lack sustain for his team and got no global ult.
Different champs are designed for different jobs, and therefor fit into different teamcomps.
As a sustained healer, Sora should beffeckitve vs sustained damage and poke, but rather weak vs all ins, especially assasins. There are enough other supports that work vs all-ins.
If u want her to be great at peeling, countering all-ins, sustaining like a boss while providing a global heal, where exactly would be her weak spot?

She absolutely needs the ability to peel for her carry, since as a support, you can't rely on the rest of the team to do that for you. I cannot tell you how many times I've seen something like "Zed mid, Tryndamere/Riven top, Lee Sin jungle", leading to the feared 4 AD comp that has you as a support babysitting a bunch of glass cannons.

The slow on the Q is incredibly hard to hit unless you are more or less within melee range of the enemy, and it's also not that good of a slow. The snare on the E is practically impossible to land, given that it has a 1.5 second delay.

She's really not that good against burst damage either. Sure, her W is on a 1.2 sec CD at max CDR and ranks, but we all know there are assassins and burst mages who can pour out extraordinary amounts of damage in a single second.
Awesome idea, but I'd make it have a stattic cooldown (200 sec?). Healing after Chronoshifted, Guardian Angel and finally dying seems OP.

Well, the idea is that this makes Guardian Angel worth on Soraka. Otherwise it's a horrendously expensive item that Soraka is expected to buy on a support's budget, on top of her core items (Talisman, boots, sightstone and chalice). Guardian Angel gives Soraka the resists she needs (rather than HP), and with this new passive, it also gives her unprecedented healing potential in teamfights.

Otherwise it's just not worth buying on a support.
